item.title: Spence add a quote by Dylan Thomas
Spence add a quote by Thomas Jefferson
item.description: "The people cannot be all, and always, well informed. The part which is wrong will be discontented, in proportion to the importance of the facts they misconceive. If they remain quiet under such misconceptions, it is lethargy, the forerunner of death to the public liberty. ... What country before ever existed a century and half without a rebellion? And what country can preserve its liberties if their rulers are not warned from time to time that their people preserve the spirit of resistance? Let them take arms. The remedy is to set them right as to facts, pardon and pacify them. What signify a few lives lost in a century or two? The tree of liberty must be refreshed from time to time with the blood of patriots and tyrants. It is its natural manure." -- Thomas Jefferson

item.title: Spence add a quote by James Otis
item.description: "I am forced to get my living by the labour of my hand; and the sweat of my brow... for bitter bread, earned under the frowns of some who have no natural or divine right to be above me, and entirely owe their grandeur and honor to grinding the faces of the poor..." -- James Otis

item.title: Spence add a quote by A.S. Byatt
item.description: "The individual appears for an instant, joins the community of thought, modifies it and dies; but the species, that dies not, reaps the fruit of his ephemeral existence." -- A.S. Byatt

item.title: Spence add a quote by A.S. Byatt
item.description: "Art does not exist for politics, or for instruction- it exists primarily for pleasure, or it is nothing." -- A.S. Byatt

item.title: Spence add a quote by Leonardo da Vinci
item.description: "The function of muscle is to pull and not to push, except in the case of the genitals and the tongue." -- Leonardo da Vinci

item.title: Spence add a quote by Randall Jarell
item.description: "A poet is a man who manages, in a lifetime of standing out in thunderstorms, to be struck by lightning five or six times." -- Randall Jarell

item.title: Spence add a quote by Anne Sexton
item.description: "Watch out for intellect, because it knows so much it knows nothing and leaves you hanging upside down, mouthing knowledge as your heart falls out of your mouth." -- Anne Sexton

item.title: Spence add a quote by Benjamin Franklin
item.description: "Either write something worth reading or do something worth writing." -- Benjamin Franklin

item.title: Spence add a quote by Benjamin Franklin
item.description: "You may delay, but time will not." -- Benjamin Franklin

item.title: Spence add a quote by Martin Luther King Jr.
item.description: "Never, never be afraid to do what's right, especially if the well-being of a person or animal is at stake. Society's punishments are small compared to the wounds we inflict on our soul when we look the other way." -- Martin Luther King Jr.

item.title: Spence add a quote by Martin Luther King Jr.
item.description:
"On some positions, cowardice asks the question, is it expedient? And then expedience comes along and asks the question, is it politic? Vanity asks the question, is it popular? Conscience asks the question, is it right?
There comes a time when one must take the position that is neither safe nor politic nor popular, but he must do it because conscience tells him it is right." -- Martin Luther King Jr.

item.title: Spence add a quote by Martin Luther King Jr.
item.description: "I could never again raise my voice against the violence of the oppressed, without having first spoken clearly to the greatest purveyor of violence in the world today – my own government." -- Martin Luther King Jr.

item.title: Spence add a quote by William Shakespeare
Spence add a quote by Joe Strummer
item.description: "If I had five million pounds I'd start a radio station because something needs to be done. It would be nice to turn on the radio and hear something that didn't make you feel like smashing up the kitchen and strangling the cat." -- Joe Strummer

item.title: Spence add a quote by Michel Foucault
item.description: "Knowledge is not for knowing: knowledge is for cutting." -- Michel Foucault

item.title: Spence add a quote by Jacques Derrida
item.description: "I always dream of a pen that would be a syringe." -- Jacques Derrida

item.title: Spence add a quote by Thomas Jefferson
item.description:
"I have observed, indeed, generally, that while in protestant countries the defections from the Platonic Christianity of the priests is to Deism, in catholic countries they are to Atheism. [author:Diderot|11004], [author:D'Alembert|3295333], [author:D’Holbach|1228712], [author:Condorcet|6420223], are known to have been among the most virtuous of men. Their virtue, then, must have had some other foundation than the love of God.
[<i>Letter to Thomas Law, 13 June 1814</i>]" -- Thomas Jefferson
